abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is judged as
            partially satisfactory. However, project sustainability is
            deemed uncertain in the absence of the implementation of
            reforms in the management and funding mechanism of the road
            sector. Overall, the World Bank's performance in
            preparing and supervising the project was satisfactory. The
            Borrower's performance was mixed (less than
            satisfactory and partially satisfactory in various issues)
            between effectiveness and 1996, then it improved to
            satisfactory thereafter. The environment under which the
            project was designed changed drastically due to various
            factors that impeded the project, the most significant being
            the civil strife that broke out in 1993 and thereon,
            hampered the implementation of the project. A follow-up
            project is planned for FY2001. The key lessons learned are
            to: 1) keep the objectives few and simple; and 2) be less
            ambitious in planning different reforms in a country in
            which political risks are high and that has had no past
            experience with the private management and implementation of
            civil works.
